dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2620 IH: Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rutherford (for himself and Mr. Cuellar) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code, to enhance penalties for theft of a firearm from a Federal firearms licensee.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Firearms Licensee Protection Act of 2023.
Section 924 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (i) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: A person who knowingly violates section 922(u), or attempts to do so, shall be fined under this title, imprisoned not more than 20 years, or both.
In the case of a violation described in subparagraph (A) that occurs during the commission of—

clause.text: a burglary, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 3 years; or
a robbery, the term of imprisonment shall be not less than 5 years.

subparagraph.text: the term burglary means the unlawful entry into, or remaining in, the business premises of a licensed importer, licensed manufacturer, or licensed dealer with the intent to commit a crime; and
the term robbery has the meaning given the term in section 1951(b).

paragraph.text: in subsection (m), by inserting , or attempts to do so, after or licensed collector.
